titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Robert John Myers miscellany
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-21T16:55-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: December 20, 2013: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated; January 23, 2013: Added photofile information January 13, 2013: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated

did.abstract: Photographs of Korean troops during World War II, and sound recordings of interviews, relating to the role of the Central Intelligence Agency in American foreign policy. Interviews conducted by Ramon H. Myers.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert John Myers miscellany, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1995.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Deputy chief, Asia-Pacific Division, United States Central Intelligence Agency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Korean troops during World War II, and sound recordings of interviews, relating to the role of the Central Intelligence Agency in American foreign policy. Interviews conducted by Ramon H. Myers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A copy created by the Stanford Archive of Recorded Sound from the cassettes found elsewhere in the box.
